meanings.definition: The state of being a concubine.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, concubinages was accepted as a form of relationship.
meanings.sent2: The king's concubinages were well-known in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The concubinages in the royal court led to much gossip among the nobles.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a series of concubinages, always in the shadow of someone else.

meanings.definition: The practice of having a concubine.
meanings.sent1: During ancient times, concubinages was common among the wealthy.
meanings.sent2: Nobles often engaged in concubinages to expand their households.
meanings.sent3: The concubinages of the emperor were a topic of intrigue in the palace.
meanings.sent4: To him, collecting art was a form of concubinages, each piece a cherished possession.
meanings.sent5: The concubinages of the past reflected a different societal structure than today.

meanings.definition: The relationship between a man and a concubine.
meanings.sent1: The concubinages between the merchant and his concubine were kept secret.
meanings.sent2: In some historical accounts, concubinages were seen as a symbol of power.
